footnotes.footnote: These represented the amount of water that the consumers actually used and were billed for.
Data refer to public supply water used by domestic sector.
Data refer to use of water from public water supply by services and private households.
Data refers to water consumption billed by Drinking Water Supply and Sewage Water Industry (EPSAS) from the capital cities, except from Cobija. Water lost during transportation is not included.

Data refers to water consumption billed by Drinking Water Supply and Sewage Water Industry (EPSAS) from the capital cities, except from Trinidad and Cobija. Water lost during transportation is not included.

Data refers to water consumption billed by Drinking Water Supply and Sewage Water Industry (EPSAS) from the capital cities, except from Tarija, Trinidad and Cobija. Water lost during transportation is not included.

Data refers to water consumption billed by Drinking Water Supply and Sewage Water Industry (EPSAS) from the capital cities, except from Orujo, Tarija, Trinidad and Cobija. Water lost during transportation is not included.
Excluding supply of fresh water for flushing (data given are based on financial year instead of calendar year).
Estimated value.
1994 data.
Data refer to the commercial sector and households.
Data refer to Addis Ababa city only.
Data refer to projected water demands.
This category includes households and commercial establishments.
Data include supply by water supply industry (ISIC 36) and self supply.
Average between 1990 and 1995.

The value should be between 52 and 57 mio m3/an. It is inflated because it also includes the values for Net freshwater delivered by water supply industry of which delivered to: Manufacturing and Other economic activities.
The figures given here are only pertaining to the water supplied by Male' Water and Sewage Co.Pvt.Ltd.
Supply: abstracted volumes of water granted in concessions.
Includes water supplied to the domestic sector.
The information corresponds to the province of Lima and the Constitutional province of Callao.
Public water supply survey was not conducted during the period 2000 - 2004; data estimated based on the Industrial water survey (for 2002 and 2003).
Data refer to Serbia and Montenegro.
Data refer to domestic consumption.
Data include public supply to businesses, institutions, etc.
Data refer to water produced by the National Water and Sewerage Corporation (NWSC). The NWSC only delivers water in larger towns and cities.
The share of household/domestic in the water produced by NWSC is 48%. UNSD calculated the figure based on this information. It may include water losses during transport.

The data for freshwater delivered by water supply industry are provided by the public institution only (public network), and are related to the government (public sector only) and where the majority is urban. It does not include private or cooperative networks. The percentage only applies to the population connected to water supply industry from the public sector only.
